spell.name: Change Material

m.text: a common material used in the casting the spell, which is consumed by the spell, turning into the new material)

entries: Du omvandlar ett vanligt material till ett annat material med samma eller mindre massa och värde.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: När du kastar den här besvärjelsen med hjälp av en spell slot på 4:e eller 5:e nivån kan du konvertera ett ovanligt material på samma sätt. När du kastar den här besvärjelsen med hjälp av en spell slot på 6:e eller 7:e nivån kan du konvertera ett sällsynt material på samma sätt. När du kastar den här besvärjelsen med hjälp av en 8:e eller 9:e nivå kan du konvertera ett mycket sällsynt material på samma sätt.

spell.name: Conjure Tool
entries: Du trollar fram ett hantverksverktyg som du väljer. Det är magiskt till sin natur, men fungerar som en icke-magisk version av detta hantverksverktyg under hela tiden.

spell.name: Dimensional Toolbox
entries: Du trollar fram en öppning till en dimensionell verktygslåda. Den är fylld med alla hantverksverktyg och vanliga material för upp till 10 gp. Som en handling kan du sträcka dig in och ta ut ett verktyg eller material som finns i den. Varje verktyg eller material som inte används när förtrollningen upphör försvinner (material som används i hantverksrecept finns kvar).

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: När du kastar den här besvärjelsen med en spellokal på 5:e nivå eller högre, innehåller verktygslådan +1 verktyg (verktyg som ger +1 till den utförda hantverkskontrollen). När du kastar den här besvärjelsen med hjälp av en trollformelplats på 9:e nivån innehåller verktygslådan +2 verktyg (verktyg som lägger till +2 till den utförda hantverkskontrollen).

spell.name: Dimensional Workshop
entries: Du trollar fram en utomdimensionell bostad inom räckhåll som varar under hela tiden. Du väljer var dess ena ingång är belägen. Ingången skimrar svagt och är 5 fot bred och 10 fot hög. Du och alla varelser du utser när du uttalar besvärjelsen kan gå in i den extradimensionella bostaden så länge portalen är öppen. Du kan öppna eller stänga portalen om du befinner dig inom 30 fot från den. När portalen är stängd är den {@condition invisible}.
Bakom portalen finns en magnifik foajé med många kamrar. Atmosfären är ren, fräsch och varm.

Du kan skapa vilken planlösning du vill, men utrymmet får inte överstiga 20 kuber, där varje kub är tre meter på varje sida. Platsen är utrustad med alla hantverksverktyg och typiska hantverkstillbehör som du kan behöva: städ, ugnar, vävstolar osv. Möbler och andra föremål som skapas med denna besvärjelse försvinner i rök om de avlägsnas från verkstaden. När förtrollningen upphör fördrivs alla varelser som befinner sig i det extradimensionella utrymmet till de öppna utrymmena närmast ingången.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: När du använder den här besvärjelsen med en spelledare på 7:e nivån eller högre, varar boendet i 24 timmar.

spell.name: Forge Fire
entries: En medelstor eld inom räckhåll, t.ex. en lägereld, brinner med onaturlig hetta i glöden under hela tiden. Den avger intensiv värme, ger dubbelt så mycket skada till alla varelser som tar skada av den och förbrukar material dubbelt så snabbt som normalt. Under varaktigheten kan den fungera som en smedja för att smälta icke-magiska metaller, och räknas som en smedja i enlighet med {@book blacksmithing|KTKCG|12}.

spell.name: Process Hide

components.m: a {@item hide|KTKCG} which is consumed by the spell

entries: Du använder magi i en {@item hide|KTKCG} och förvandlar den till {@item processed leather|KTKCG}. Om du koncentrerar dig under hela tiden kan du förvandla en enda {@item hide|KTKCG} till en {@item rawhide leather|KTKCG}, {@item boiled leather|KTKCG} eller {@item tanned leather|KTKCG}. Alternativt kan du förvandla {@item hide scraps|KTKCG} till {@item leather scraps|KTKCG}.

spell.name: Unseen Crafter

components.m: a bit of string and wood

entries: Denna besvärjelse skapar en {@condition invisible}, tanklös, formlös, medium kraft som utför enkla uppgifter på ditt kommando tills besvärjelsen upphör. Crafteraren sprunger till existens i ett obebott utrymme på marken inom räckvidd. Den har AC 10, 1 träffpunkt och en styrka på 2, och den kan inte attackera. Om den sjunker till 0 träffpunkter upphör förtrollningen.

En gång under varje varv som en bonusåtgärd kan du mentalt beordra hantverkaren att röra sig upp till 15 fot och interagera med ett objekt. Crafter kan utföra enkla uppgifter som en mänsklig tjänare skulle kunna göra, till exempel hämta saker, städa, laga, vika kläder, tända eldar, servera mat och hälla upp vin. Dessutom kan den utföra skickliga hantverkskontroller. Den använder alltid {@variantrule taking 10|KTKCG}-regeln för hantverkskontroller och genomför en kontroll var 4:e timme. Dess hantverksmodifierare är +5. När du kallar den kan du kalla den med ett hantverksverktyg efter eget val, som bara den kan använda. Den kan använda alla andra hantverksverktyg som annars är tillgängliga. Om du kastar den här besvärjelsen igen medan hantverkaren fortfarande existerar, försvinner den föregående besvärjelsen.

När du ger ett kommando utför tjänaren uppgiften efter bästa förmåga tills den är klar och väntar sedan på ditt nästa kommando. Om du beordrar tjänaren att utföra en uppgift som skulle förflytta den mer än 60 fot från dig upphör förtrollningen.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: När du kastar den här besvärjelsen med en spell slot på 6:e nivån eller högre ökar dess hantverksmodifierare med 1.

baseitem.name: Unit of Lumber
entries: You can convert trees that are at least 20 feet tall into {@item unit of lumber|KTKCG|units of lumber}. A 20 foot tall tree will produce 1 {@item unit of lumber|KTKCG|units of lumber}, and an additional {@item unit of lumber|KTKCG|units of lumber} for each 10 feet of tree height. At your GM's discretion, some trees may not be suitable lumber. It takes 4 hours of work by a laborer to convert trees to {@item unit of lumber|KTKCG|units of lumber}.
A {@item unit of lumber|KTKCG|units of lumber} can be converted to 10 {@item common branch|KTKCG|common branches}.

baseitem.name: Unit of Stone
entries: Quarrying Stone is significantly harder and at the edge of what this system attempts to define. As a rule of thumb, if a quarry that can produce stone is available, 1 laborer can produce 1 {@item unit of stone|KTKCG|units of stone} in 8 hours of hard labor (1 unit per day). A laborer with a Strength ability score of 18 or higher can produce twice as much stone in the same time period.
Att anlägga ett stenbrott är inte möjligt med detta system, men det skulle ta dagar eller veckor.

item.name: +1 Amplifying Crystal
item.reqAttune: by a psionic character with one or more psi points
entries: While holding this crystal, you gain a +1 bonus to psionics attack rolls and to the psionic saving throw DCs of your psionic abilities. In addition, when you use a psionic power, you can add 1 psi point; this point can only be used on psionic powers, but can exceed your normal psi limit. You can't use this property again until you finish a long rest.

item.name: +1 Psi Blade Crystal
entries: Embedded in a ring, braclet, bladeless sword hilt, or similar item, this small gem seems to have minimal value to the casual observer, but has perfect psionic resonance.

While carried by a {@class Mystic|UATheMysticClass|Way of the Soul Knife Monk|Soul Knife|UATheMysticClass}, that monk can use this crystal to focus a purer {@subclassFeature Soul Knife|Mystic|UATheMysticClass|Soul Knife|UATheMysticClass|1|UATheMysticClass|Soul Knife}, adding +1 to attack and damage rolls with their {@subclassFeature Soul Knife|Mystic|UATheMysticClass|Soul Knife|UATheMysticClass|1|UATheMysticClass|Soul Knife}.
Some crystals come in various colors, and change the hue of your psi blade to match the color of the crystal.

item.name: +2 Amplifying Crystal

In addition, when you use a psionic power, you can add 2 psi points; these points can only be used on psionic powers, but can exceed your normal psi limit. You can't use this property again until you finish a long rest.

item.name: 1st-Level Spell Scroll
entries: A spell scroll bears the words of a single spell, written as a mystical cipher. If the spell is on your class's spell list, you can read the scroll and cast its spell without providing any material components. Otherwise, the scroll is unintelligible. Casting the spell by reading the scroll requires the spell's normal casting time. Once the spell is cast, the words on the scroll fade, and it crumbles to dust. If the casting is interrupted, the scroll is not lost.

If the spell is on your class's spell list but of a higher level than you can normally cast, you must make an ability check using your spellcasting ability to determine whether you cast it successfully. The DC is 11. On a failed check, the spell disappears from the scroll with no other effect.
Once the spell is cast, the words on the scroll fade, and the scroll itself crumbles to dust.
A spell cast from this scroll has a save DC of 13 and an attack bonus of {@hit 5}.

A wizard spell on a spell scroll can be copied just as spells in spellbooks can be copied. When a spell is copied from a spell scroll, the copier must succeed on a DC 11 Intelligence ({@skill Arcana}) check. If the check succeeds, the spell is successfully copied. Whether the check succeeds or fails, the spell scroll is destroyed.

item.name: 2nd-Level Spell Scroll
entries: A spell scroll bears the words of a single spell, written as a mystical cipher. If the spell is on your class's spell list, you can read the scroll and cast its spell without providing any material components. Otherwise, the scroll is unintelligible. Casting the spell by reading the scroll requires the spell's normal casting time. Once the spell is cast, the words on the scroll fade, and it crumbles to dust. If the casting is interrupted, the scroll is not lost.

If the spell is on your class's spell list but of a higher level than you can normally cast, you must make an ability check using your spellcasting ability to determine whether you cast it successfully. The DC is 12. On a failed check, the spell disappears from the scroll with no other effect.
Once the spell is cast, the words on the scroll fade, and the scroll itself crumbles to dust.
A spell cast from this scroll has a save DC of 13 and an attack bonus of {@hit 5}.

A wizard spell on a spell scroll can be copied just as spells in spellbooks can be copied. When a spell is copied from a spell scroll, the copier must succeed on a DC 12 Intelligence ({@skill Arcana}) check. If the check succeeds, the spell is successfully copied. Whether the check succeeds or fails, the spell scroll is destroyed.

Once the spell is cast, the words on the scroll fade, and the scroll itself crumbles to dust.
A spell cast from this scroll has a save DC of 15 and an attack bonus of {@hit 7}.

If the casting is interrupted, the scroll is not lost.

Once the spell is cast, the words on the scroll fade, and the scroll itself crumbles to dust.
A spell cast from this scroll has a save DC of 15 and an attack bonus of {@hit 7}.

Whether the check succeeds or fails, the spell scroll is destroyed.

Once the spell is cast, the words on the scroll fade, and the scroll itself crumbles to dust.
A spell cast from this scroll has a save DC of 17 and an attack bonus of {@hit 9}.

A wizard spell on a spell scroll can be copied just as spells in spellbooks can be copied. When a spell is copied from a spell scroll, the copier must succeed on a DC 15 Intelligence ({@skill Arcana}) check. If the check succeeds, the spell is successfully copied. Whether the check succeeds or fails, the spell scroll is destroyed.

If the casting is interrupted, the scroll is not lost.

Once the spell is cast, the words on the scroll fade, and the scroll itself crumbles to dust.
A spell cast from this scroll has a save DC of 17 and an attack bonus of {@hit 9}.

A wizard spell on a spell scroll can be copied just as spells in spellbooks can be copied. When a spell is copied from a spell scroll, the copier must succeed on a DC 16 Intelligence ({@skill Arcana}) check. If the check succeeds, the spell is successfully copied. Whether the check succeeds or fails, the spell scroll is destroyed.

Casting the spell by reading the scroll requires the spell's normal casting time. Once the spell is cast, the words on the scroll fade, and it crumbles to dust. Once the spell is cast, the words on the scroll fade, and the scroll itself crumbles to dust.
A spell cast from this scroll has a save DC of 18 and an attack bonus of {@hit 10}.

A wizard spell on a spell scroll can be copied just as spells in spellbooks can be copied. When a spell is copied from a spell scroll, the copier must succeed on a DC 17 Intelligence ({@skill Arcana}) check. If the check succeeds, the spell is successfully copied. Whether the check succeeds or fails, the spell scroll is destroyed.

If the spell is on your class's spell list, you can read the scroll and cast its spell without providing any material components. Otherwise, the scroll is unintelligible. Casting the spell by reading the scroll requires the spell's normal casting time. Once the spell is cast, the words on the scroll fade, and it crumbles to dust. If the casting is interrupted, the scroll is not lost.

If the spell is on your class's spell list but of a higher level than you can normally cast, you must make an ability check using your spellcasting ability to determine whether you cast it successfully. The DC is 18. On a failed check, the spell disappears from the scroll with no other effect.
Once the spell is cast, the words on the scroll fade, and the scroll itself crumbles to dust.
A spell cast from this scroll has a save DC of 18 and an attack bonus of {@hit 10}.

A wizard spell on a spell scroll can be copied just as spells in spellbooks can be copied. When a spell is copied from a spell scroll, the copier must succeed on a DC 18 Intelligence ({@skill Arcana}) check. If the check succeeds, the spell is successfully copied. Whether the check succeeds or fails, the spell scroll is destroyed.

item.name: 9th-Level Spell Scroll
entries: A spell scroll bears the words of a single spell, written as a mystical cipher. If the spell is on your class's spell list, you can read the scroll and cast its spell without providing any material components. Otherwise, the scroll is unintelligible. Casting the spell by reading the scroll requires the spell's normal casting time. Once the spell is cast, the words on the scroll fade, and it crumbles to dust. If the casting is interrupted, the scroll is not lost.

If the spell is on your class's spell list but of a higher level than you can normally cast, you must make an ability check using your spellcasting ability to determine whether you cast it successfully. The DC is 19. On a failed check, the spell disappears from the scroll with no other effect.
Once the spell is cast, the words on the scroll fade, and the scroll itself crumbles to dust.
A spell cast from this scroll has a save DC of 19 and an attack bonus of {@hit 11}.

A wizard spell on a spell scroll can be copied just as spells in spellbooks can be copied. When a spell is copied from a spell scroll, the copier must succeed on a DC 19 Intelligence ({@skill Arcana}) check. If the check succeeds, the spell is successfully copied. Whether the check succeeds or fails, the spell scroll is destroyed.

item.name: Adamantine Bracers
entries: While wearing bracers and not using a {@item shield|PHB}, as a reaction to being hit by an attack, you can attempt to parry the attack with your bracer, adding +2 AC bonus against the triggering attack. If this causes your AC to be exactly equal to the attack roll and the attacking weapon is made of a common metal, the attacking weapon is destroyed.

item.name: Adaptable Shot
entries: You can select a different damage type for the attack from bludgeoning, piercing, slashing, acid, cold, fire, or lightning when firing this shot. When you recover this arrow, roll a {@dice d6}. On a 1, it is broken.

item.name: Alchemical Napalm
entries: A vicious sticky flammable substance. It deals {@damage 3d4} fire damage when poured on an object. Can be used as a simple ranged weapon with the thrown (20/60) property, dealing {@damage 3d4} fire damage on hit. You do not add your modifier to the damage roll.

On hit, the target creature or object continues to burn for one minute, taking {@damage 1d4} fire damage at the start of their turn (or at the start of your turn for an object without a turn) until a creature spends an action to put the flames out.

item.name: Apple of Arborea
entries: Consuming this apple has the effect of {@spell greater restoration} cast upon the person that consumes it. If the creature that consumes it is Good aligned, they gain the benefit of {@spell death ward} until they finish a long rest.
Adding it to a potion makes that potion confer the effects of eating it, but has no alignment restrictions.

item.name: Arcblade
entries: This item appears to be a longsword hilt. While grasping the hilt, you can use a bonus action to cause a blade of dark lightning to spring into existence, or make the blade disappear. While the blade exists, this magic longsword has the finesse property. If you are proficient with shortswords or longswords, you are proficient with the arcblade.

You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon, which deals lightning damage instead of slashing damage. When you hit a creature with it, you can cause lightning to arc from the target to a different creature of your choice that you can see within 5 feet of it. The second creature takes {@damage 1d8} lightning damage.

The arcblade is able to absorb ambient electrical energy to briefly enter a supercharged state. If you take lightning damage while this weapon's blade is active, you can use your reaction to capture some of that energy and store it for up to 1 minute. The first time you hit with the arcblade before the end of the duration, the target takes additional lightning damage equal to half of the damage you took. This property can't be used again until the next dusk.
{@note Item and art by {@link Dungeon Strugglers|https://www.artstation.com/dungeon_strugglers}}

item.name: Basic Leg Prosthetic
entries: A functional replacement leg. While using this in replacement for one of your legs, your speed is reduced by 10 feet and you have disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws and Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) checks.

item.name: Basilisk Eye
entries: At first glance, it looks like a stone.
When this and 1 {@item common divine essence|KTKCG} is added to any healing potion, that healing potion also removes the {@condition petrified} condition when used.

item.name: Blacksmith's Bellows
entries: These are a small set of portable bellows. Can be used to cast {@spell forge fire|KTKCG} without expending a spell slot. Once used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Blast Stick
entries: This wand has an 20 charges. This wand is considered a ranged weapon with a range of 60/180, and the Light property. It deals {@damage 1d6} force damage on hit. Each time you make an attack with it, it expends one charge. If you have a spellcasting modifier, you can use your spellcasting ability in place of your Dexterity modifier when making an attack with this wand.
The wand regains {@dice 1d10 + 10} expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the wand's last charge, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, the wand breaks.

item.name: Blasting Crystal
item.reqAttune: by a psionic character with one or more psi points
entries: While holding this crystal, an attuned user can focus their psionic powers into it emit a powerful psionic blast. It emits a ray of concentrated psionic power blasts toward a creature or object you can see within 60 feet. Make a ranged spell attack. On hit, it deals {@damage 1d10} + your Psionics modifier force damage.

You can spend psi points add the following modifiers to (you can add multiple modifiers). The points must be spent when choosing the target of the power. If you have the Psionic Mastery feature, you can spend mastery points on this as if was a psionic power.

entries.name: Amplified Blast (1-3 points)
entries: The target takes an extra {@damage 1d10} force damage.

entries.name: Omni Blast (1+ points)
entries: The blast targets a number of additional creatures equal to the psi points spents.

entries.name: Soul Blast (1 point)
entries: The blast damage becomes psychic damage, and treats the targets AC as 10 + their Dexterity modifier.

item.name: Blasting Powder
entries: A fine grey powder with large grains and the faint smell of sulfur and charcoal that comes in small packets weighing 1/2 pound.

When ignited by 1 or more fire or lightning damage, it explodes violently. All creatures within 10 feet of it must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw. On failure, they take {@dice 1d4} fire damage + {@damage 1d4} thunder damage, or half as much on a success. The amount of damage increases by {@dice 1d4} (both the fire and thunder) and the radius increases by 5 feet for each additional packet of Blasting Powder detonated in the same spot, up to a maximum of five packets. Deals double damage to buildings and structures. Creatures in range of more than one stack of up to 5 explosives at the same time take damage only from the highest damage effect.
Frequently used for mining and other responsible things... until adventurers get their hands on it.

item.name: Blood
entries: A swirling rune with repeating spiraling patterns that pulses with a deep red light.

entries.name: Passive Effect
entries: When marked on a weapon, if an attuned wielder deals damage with that weapon to a living creature of CR 1/4 or higher, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 1d4} necrotic damage, and the wielder regains hit points equal to the necrotic damage dealt.

entries.name: Active Effect
entries: After dealing necrotic damage with this weapon, an attuned wielder can use their bonus action to activate the rune, drawing the blood of the creature dealing an extra {@damage 3d4} necrotic damage, and regainin hit points equal to the additional necrotic damage dealt. Once a rune's power is used, the rune's active can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Bottled Wind
entries: As an action, you can open this casting {@spell gust|XGE} without verbal or somatic components. Alternatively, you can breath from it, letting out only a little bit at a time, breathing directly from the bottle, but each time you must make a {@dc 5} {@skill athletics} checks. On failure, you cast {@spell gust|XGE} as above and all the air is lost. You can get 10 minutes of breathable air from one bottle.

item.name: Bouncing Shot
entries: You can attack a target out of line of sight of with it if you know their location by bouncing it off a surface. They have the benefit of half cover instead of full cover when firing this shot. When you recover this arrow, roll a {@dice d6}. On a 1, it is broken.

item.name: Boundless Toolbelt
entries: While wearing this toolbelt, you can cast {@spell conjure tool|KTKCG} as an action, drawing forth the tool from your toolbelt.

item.name: Bracers
entries: While wearing bracers and not using a {@item shield|PHB}, as a reaction to being hit by an attack, you can attempt to parry the attack with your bracer, adding +2 AC bonus against the triggering attack.

item.name: Breastplate of the Golden Retriever
entries: You have a +1 bonus to AC and advantage on saving throws to resist being {@condition frightened} while wearing this armor.

This armor has 3 charges, which it regains daily at dawn. As an action, you can expend 1 charge to cast the {@spell warding bond} spell or 2 charges to cast the {@spell Mordenkainen's Faithful Hound|PHB|faithful hound} spell from the armor without requiring material components. When warding bond is cast in this way, a spectral golden retriever appears next to the creature you are bonded with and follows it dutifully. The golden retriever is incorporeal and it can shed bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet upon the bonded creature's request (no action required).
{@note Item and art by {@link Dungeon Strugglers|https://www.artstation.com/dungeon_strugglers}}

item.name: Brilliant Diamond
entries: This diamond gives off 5 feet of dim light when not socketed. When socketed into a weapon, ring, or necklace, a creature holding that weapon or wearing the piece of jewelry can use their action to cast the {@spell light} spell, targeting the item the gem is socketed into.

item.name: Brutality
entries: A rune made of large chaotic interlocking pattern that burns with a dull orange light.

entries.name: Passive Effect
entries: When marked on a weapon, an attuned wielder of the weapon is healed for {@dice 1d12} hit points when deal a critical strike with the marked weapon.

entries.name: Active Effect
entries: An attuned wielder can activate the rune (no action required) during their turn. Until the end of their turn, whenever they miss an attack roll against a target within their reach, the attack still deals half damage to the target. Once activated, it can't be activated until the next dawn.

item.name: Burning Oil
entries: As an action, you can coat a weapon in this oil and ignite it. For 1 minute, the ignited weapon burns, dealing an extra {@dice 1d4} fire to attacks made with it, and providing bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet.

item.name: Burning Wound
entries: Applied to a melee weapon or up to 5 pieces of ammunition. A creature subjected to this poison must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC equal to the crafter's Poison DC.

On failure, the target becomes {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. While {@condition poisoned} this way, a creature takes {@damage 1d6} fire damage at the end of each of its turns, and any hit points regained is reduced by half. At the end of each of their turns, they can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on success.
Once applied, the poison retains potency for 1 minute before drying, and wears off of a weapon after that weapon has delivered the effect 5 times.

item.name: Cantrip Spell Scroll
entries: A spell scroll bears the words of a single spell, written as a mystical cipher. If the spell is on your class's spell list, you can read the scroll and cast its spell without providing any material components. Otherwise, the scroll is unintelligible. Casting the spell by reading the scroll requires the spell's normal casting time. Once the spell is cast, the words on the scroll fade, and it crumbles to dust. If the casting is interrupted, the scroll is not lost.

If the spell is on your class's spell list but of a higher level than you can normally cast, you must make an ability check using your spellcasting ability to determine whether you cast it successfully. The DC is 10. On a failed check, the spell disappears from the scroll with no other effect.
Once the spell is cast, the words on the scroll fade, and the scroll itself crumbles to dust.
A spell cast from this scroll has a save DC of 13 and an attack bonus of {@hit 5}.

item.name: Captain's Coat
entries: Functional and fashionable, this long pirate captain's coat is reinforced for combat and draws the eyes to its ornate design. While wearing this coat, you have proficiency in {@item navigator's tools|PHB}, vehicles (water) and you have a swimming speed equal to your walking speed.

Multiple pockets are hidden on the inside of the coat, able to conceal small objects. A creature attempting to search your person must succeed on a {@dc 15} Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) check in order to discover the hidden pockets.

entries.name: Sailor's Mouth
entries: Once per short or long rest, you can use a bonus action to cast the {@spell vicious mockery} spell (save {@dc 15}) while wearing the coat. When cast in this way, the target takes extra psychic damage equal to your Charisma modifier.
{@note Item and art by {@link Dungeon Strugglers|https://www.artstation.com/dungeon_strugglers}}

item.name: Cascade Catalyst
entries: While holding this catalyst, you can use it as spell casting focus for your spells. When you roll damage for a spell, for each die that rolls its highest value, you can roll one additional die of the same type and add it to the damage dealt.

item.name: Catfern
entries: A light and airy fern that tends to get easily caught in the wind and slightly glows.

When added to any potion you consume, you gain 30 feet of {@sense darkvision} for the duration of the potion effect. If you already have {@sense darkvision}, the range of your {@sense darkvision} increases by 30 feet for the duration of the effect.
When added to a {@item Potion of Climbing}, it also grants you a climbing speed equal to your walking speed in addition to its normal effects.

item.name: Clockwork Toy
entries: This toy is a clockwork animal, monster, or person, such as a frog, mouse, bird, Dragon, or Soldier. When placed on the ground, the toy moves 5 feet across the ground on each of your turns in a random direction. It makes noises as appropriate to the creature it represents.

item.name: Color
entries: A multifaced rune the glimmers a shifting color. A creature that touches an item with this rune can change the color of that item as an action.

item.name: Common Alchemical Acid
entries: A small flask of burbling acid, a strange hissing green viscous liquid. It deals {@damage 4d4} acid damage when poured on an object. Can be used as a simple ranged weapon with the thrown (20/60) property, dealing {@damage 4d4} acid damage on hit. You do not add your modifier to the damage roll.

item.name: Common Alchemical Fire
entries: A small flask of volatile orange liquid. It deals {@damage 2d10} fire damage when poured on an object. Can be used as a simple ranged weapon with the thrown (20/60) property, dealing {@damage 2d10} fire damage on hit. You do not add your modifier to the damage roll.

item.name: Common Explosive
entries: A bundled explosive alchemical preparation. It can be detonated by dealing 1 fire or lightning damage to it. As an action, a packet of this explosive can be accurately thrown 20 feet, but will not detonate on impact (usually). When it detonates, all creatures within 10 feet (for common) of the target point must make a Dexterity saving throw with a DC equal to the crafter's Alchemy DC. On failure, they take {@damage 1d8} fire + {@damage 1d8} thunder damage, or half as much on a success. Creatures in range of more than one explosive take damage only from the highest damage effect.

item.name: Common Feast
entries: Up to 5 creatures can consume this feast within an hour of it being prepared. After consuming this hearty meal, you become satiated for the next 24 hours. This is a hearty meal well surpassing the benefits of normal meals or rations, and each creature that consumes it regains an additional Hit Die during the next long rest.

If cooked by a creature with proficiency in {@item Cook's Utensils|PHB}, creatures that consume this feast regain additional Hit Dice equal to the cook's proficiency bonus during the next long rest instead.

item.name: Comprehension
entries: A rune that resembles a script that no one can determine the nature of, glowing a steady white-blue light.

entries.name: Passive Effect
entries: When marked on armor or an item, the attuned wearer can read all writing, even if it is not in a language they would normally understand. This confers only the literal meaning of the text, and doesn't break a cipher or code.

entries.name: Active Effect
entries: While attuned to an item with this rune, you can cast {@spell comprehend languages} without expending a spell slot. Once activated, it can't be activated again until the next dawn.

item.name: Connection
entries: A rune made up of an interlocking square, circle, and triangle, that courses with pure white light.

entries.name: Passive Effect
entries: When marked on an item, an attuned wearer can spend an action to gain supernatural insight into other sentient creatures for 10 minutes. You gain advantage on all Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) checks, but dealing damage to another sentient creature while in this heightened state of awareness causes you to take 1 psychic damage.

entries.name: Active Effect
entries: While attuned to an item with this rune, you can force another creature to experience a brief flash of connection to your state of mind. The effects of this may vary, but most often allows you to gain advantage on a Charisma ({@skill Persuasion}) check with them. If used as a reaction to taking damage, you can force the creature that dealt the damage to you to take psychic damage equal to half the damage dealt. Once activated, it can't be activated again until the next dawn.

item.name: Crystal Ball of Thieving
entries: This {@item crystal ball} is about 6 inches in diameter. While touching it, you can cast the {@spell scrying} spell (save {@dc 17}) with it.

You can use an action to cast the {@spell mage hand} spell while you are {@spell scrying} with the {@item crystal ball}, the spectral hand appearing within 30 feet of the spell's sensor. When cast in this way you can make the spectral hand {@condition invisible}. When the {@spell scrying} ends, so does the spell, and any object held by the spectral hand is teleported into your open hand or to an unoccupied space at your feet. Teleporting an object via this method is unreliable and has a chance to fail. Roll a {@dice d20} to determine if you are successful. If you have had physical contact with the object before add 5 to your roll. If the object has spent more than 24 hours in your possession, add 10. The DC is 15. On a failure, the object reappears in the space that it occupied before the spectral hand interacted with it, or in the nearest unoccupied space if that space is now occupied. Once used, the thieving power of the {@item crystal ball} can't be used again until the next dawn.

entries.name: Curse
entries: Each time you successfully steal an item using this {@item crystal ball}, the owner of the item immediately sees an image of your face and hears your name in their mind. They don't necessarily know the context, but if your theft arouses suspicion, it's a likely deduction that you are related to the disappearance of their possession.
{@note Item and art by {@link Dungeon Strugglers|https://www.artstation.com/dungeon_strugglers}}

item.name: Crystal Key
entries: An intricate crystaline doorknob with intricate carved patterns. This crystal contains a psionically constructed space that can be manifested by placing it against any flat vertical surface large enough for a Medium-sized door to appear on, and speaking the command word. It creates a door that leads into this interdimensional space. The size of this space depends on the size of the object the doorknob is placed again. If the space is at least 10 feet long by 10 feet wide, it creates a simply furnished bedroom with a bed, light, chair and desk. The atmosphere in the room is comfortable and the air is breathable.
For each additional 10 cubic feet of space in the object the door knob is placed in, additional rooms appear, in the following order:

items: A bathroom furnished with wash tub and running water (the water is potable).
A comfortable study furnished with a writing table, chair, bookshelves and fireplace.
A workshop with basic artisan tools and work benches.
A kitchen that contains no food, but all basic cooking tools, and an always hot oven.
Additional bedrooms, up to four additional rooms.
Anything created by the extradimensional space can't leave the extradimensional space.

entries: These rooms are extradimensional and do not truly exist within the object, and can't be accessed by any means other than through the door (they do not structurally effect the object, or allow you to access entraces or areas within the object).

item.name: Dagger of the Ogre Mage
entries: This blade was once used as a {@item dagger|PHB} by an ogre, but is nevertheless large enough to be a {@item shortsword|PHB}. You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

This blade's hilt is hollow and can hold up to 3 {@item cantrip spell scroll|KTKCG|cantrip spell scrolls}. Cantrip scrolls left within the compartment for 1 minute activate one of the three clear gems adorning its grip. Once activated, you can cast these cantrips at will using your spellcasting modifier. If you don't have a spellcasting modifier, use your Intelligence modifier instead. You have proficiency with these cantrips. Cantrips cast from the blade use the weapon as an arcane focus and allow you to perform any somatic components with the weapon instead of requiring a free hand. Scrolls contained within the sword are not destroyed after using them in this way. When you cast a cantrip using the sword that deals damage, the sword's damage type changes to match the cantrip's for 1 minute or until you end it early (no action required).
Item and art by {@link Griffon's Saddlebag|https://www.thegriffonssaddlebag.com/}

item.name: Dark Fathom Armor
entries: This dark, sea-soaked suit of armor smells of brine and is covered in eldritch runes. You have a +1 bonus to AC and can breathe normally underwater while wearing this armor.

In addition, while wearing this armor, you can use an action to cast the {@spell evard's black tentacles} spell (save {@dc 15}) from it. When cast in this way, the spell targets a 15-foot square centered on your location that does not follow you when you move. In addition, you do not need to {@condition concentration|PHB|concentrate} on the spell and are immune to its effects when cast in this way. Once this property has been used, it can't be used again until the next dusk.
Item and art by {@link Griffon's Saddlebag|https://www.thegriffonssaddlebag.com/}

item.name: Death
entries: A rune of ominous complexity wreathed in shadows.

entries.name: Passive Effect
entries: While marked on armor or any item, the attuned wearer can't die unless the rune is removed from the possession. They are still {@condition incapacitated} and {@condition unconcious} when reduced to 0 hit points, but reaching 3 death saving throws has no effect while the rune is being worn or carried on their person. While attuned to this rune, undead of CR 5 or lower treat you as another undead, and only attack you if otherwise commanded to by a controlling entity or attacked by you.

entries.name: Active Effect
entries: While attuned to an item with this rune, you can use item to cast {@spell power word kill} without expending a spell slot. Once this rune's power is used, you can't use it again until the next dawn.

item.name: Decombobulator
entries: This small mysterious device can emit a projected field within 5 feet of it that heats matter until it undergoes a state change, from a solid to a liquid, or from a liquid to a gas. It has no effect on gas. The target area is always in the shape of a cube, and can be as small as a 1 inch cube or as large as a 5 foot cube. The process takes 1 minute. If a creature ends its turn in the projected field, it takes {@damage 2d6} fire damage. This damage doubles each consecutive turn it ends in the area. This damage is also taken by any creature attempting to hold or touch something in the area of effect. This field may burn away the effects of some spells that would be subject to its effects at the discretion of the GM.

item.name: Destruction
entries: A simple rune with bold slashing struct that glow with vibrant and pulsing red light.

entries.name: Passive Effects
entries: When marked on a weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 1d6} damage on hit when wielded by an attuned wearer. Its damage overcomes all resistance to damage.

entries.name: Active Effects
entries: When the attuned wielder makes an attack with a weapon marked with this rune, they can make the attack a critical hit. Once activated, it can't be activated again until the next dawn.

item.name: Dizzying Touch
entries: Applied to an object. The first creature that touches must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC equal to the crafter's Poison DC. On failure, the creature becomes {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. While {@condition poisoned} in this way, they must succeed a Wisdom saving throw at the end of each of their turns or fall {@condition prone}.

item.name: Doodle Ring
entries: This magic wooden ring is always covered in splotches of charcoal, ink, or paint, regardless of how well or often it's cleaned. While wearing the ring on a finger, you can touch that finger to a solid surface and begin to draw. The drawing uses your finger to make marks as if it were a piece of charcoal, ink quill, or paintbrush (your choice). The marks you make can be in any color. Any drawing made by the ring can be easily smudged or washed away without leaving any marks behind. The ring can have up to a total of 5 square feet covered with drawings in this way at any time. Drawing more than that begins to erase the previous marks, and any mark left after 24 hours of being made is magically erased.
Item and art by {@link Griffon's Saddlebag|https://www.thegriffonssaddlebag.com/}

item.name: Dragon Tamer Lance
entries: This slender, iridescent lance is covered in an enchanted finish that resembles the hardened scales of many dragons. You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. While attuned to the weapon, you can understand and speak {@language Draconic|PHB}.

This lance has 8 charges and regains {@dice 1d4 + 4} expended charges each day at dawn. When you hit a target with the lance, you can expend 1 of its charges to deal an extra {@damage 3d6} acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison damage (your choice) to the target. If you expend a charge in this way when you hit a dragon, it must also succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} of you until the beginning of your next turn. For the purpose of this weapon, "dragon" refers to any creature with the dragon type, including dragon turtles and wyverns.

Whenever you expend a charge in this way to deal extra damage, you can choose to expend a 2nd charge and deal an extra {@damage 1d6} damage of the same type to the target and prevent it from using its reaction until the start of its next turn.

entries.name: Wyrmling Steed
entries: In addition, while holding the lance, you can use an action to cast the {@spell find steed} spell from it. Once this property has been used, it can't be used again until the next dawn. When you use the lance to cast this spell, you can choose to summon a dragon wyrmling instead of a normal mount by expending a number of charges equal to its challenge rating (maximum 2). You determine the kind of dragon summoned, although its alignment towards good or evil must be the same as your own. If your alignment is neutral, you can summon a wyrmling of either alignment. The wyrmling counts as one size larger when used as a mount and cannot use its breath weapons.

entries.name: Forceful Impact
entries: If you move at least 20 feet straight toward a Medium or smaller target and then make a melee attack with the lance against it while within 5 feet of the target, you make the attack with advantage instead of disadvantage. If you hit, you can immediately roll to attack another target 5 feet directly behind the first, without advantage, as part of the initial attack.
Item and art by {@link Griffon's Saddlebag|https://www.thegriffonssaddlebag.com/}

item.name: Dragongrass
entries: This is a strange grass that burns very hot and tastes terrible.
When added to a {@item Potion of Fire Breath}, it allows you to replace one or more breaths with breathing fire in a cone with the effect of the spell {@spell burning hands}.
When added to a Custom Potion that would deal damage to a target area, it allows you to instead drink the potion and breath of a 15-foot cone of the damaging effect the potion would have had.

item.name: Draught of Damnation
entries: This sticky red liquid has a living viscosity to it, churning slowly within the flask. When you drink this potion, you become a fiend (as if by the spell {@spell shapechange} for 1 hour). The type of fiend you become is determined by your level. The new form is a random fiend with a Challenge Rating equal to your level, up to a maximum of 10. If there are multiple options at that Challenge Rating, roll to determine which option is selected.

When the effect ends and you revert to your normal form, you take {@damage 1d6} necrotic damage equal to the CR of the fiend who's form you assumed as the toxins of pure evil attempt to destroy your body before relinquishing control of it. If this damage kills you, your soul is dragged to the realm of the fiends by the malignant will of the fiend.

item.name: Drill
entries: Can make holes in things. Can destroy a {@item lock|PHB} with a DC of 14 or lower to pick or break with 10 minutes of work.

item.name: Dwarven Alcohol
entries: Only dwarves really know if the name of this liquid explosive is a joke or not, but must assume it is an acquired taste. An explosively flammable liquid that comes in a flask, this flask can be splashed across a 5 foot square within 5 feet. Once splashed, it can be ignited by 1 or more fire or lightning damage. When ignited it explodes in a plume of fire, dealing {@damage 2d4} fire damage to all creatures within 5 feet of the container, or within a square that has been soaked with it.

item.name: Effervescent Emerald
entries: This emerald has a swirling light within. When socketed into a weapon, checks to apply poison to that weapon automatically succeed. When socketed into a ring or necklece, a creature wearing that piece of jewelry can use their action to cast the {@spell poison spray} cantrip.

item.name: Elementally Fortifying Feast
entries: Up to 5 creatures can consume this feast within an hour of it being prepared. After consuming this hearty meal, you become satiated for the next 24 hours. The magical properties of the meal confer the following special benefits:
These benefits fade after 24 hours. You can't gain the benefits of another feast until these benefits fade and you are no longer satiated.

item.name: Elvish Bread
entries: A creature can use its action to eat one bite of this bread (1 ration of it). Eating a piece restores 1 hit point, and the bread provides enough nourishment to sustain a creature for one day.

item.name: Endless Dreams
entries: Applied to food or beverage. A creature that consumes this poison must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC equal to the crafter's Poison DC. On failure, the next time the creature falls asleep they enter endless slumber in stasis. They do not wake and can't be roused by any normal means. A creature sleeping in this way doesn't require food or drink, and doesn't age.
This effect can only be ended by {@spell greater restoration} cast at 7th level or higher, or {@spell wish}.

item.name: Enhancing Feast
entries: Up to 5 creatures can consume this feast within an hour of it being prepared. After consuming this hearty meal, you become satiated for the next 24 hours. You gain the benefits for a {@item common feast|KTKCG}, but can gain additional benefits by trading in Hit Dice that would be gained as part of your next long rest after consuming this meal. These Hit Dice are consumed after calculating how many you would have after the rest (including the benefits of the feast), but you can trade Hit Dice in this way you would normally lose if you have more than your maximum Hit Dice.
You can trade Hit Dice in this way up to a number equal to your proficiency bonus. The benefits scale based on the rarity on the feast.

entries.name: Uncommon Benefits
items: Roll a {@dice d4} per Hit Die traded and gain temporary hit points equal to the value rolled.
Trade three Hit Dice for an additional spell slot of 1st level.
Gain a point that can be expended like Inspiration by trading 5 Hit Dice per point.

entries: Any benefit from a feast fades after 24 hours.

item.name: Essence Crystal
entries: A translucent crystal capsule that contains a small amount of a mysterious dark colored liquid.
While in possession of this crystal, an attuned creature gains a +1 bonus to to ability checks and saving throws of the crystals attribute type.
These crystals can be cracked, and the liquid inside makes a potent {@item essence|KTKCG} for forging powerful runes.

entries.name: Curse
entries: While attuned to the crystal, you have vivid dreams of lives that are not your own, seeing glimpses of the souls that contributed their essence to the liquid within the crystal.

item.name: Essence Rune
entries: A special rune forged with the liquid of an {@item essence crystal|KTKCG}.
This rune empowers an item or creature it is marked on, increasing the Ability Score and maximum for the Ability Score associated with the {@item Essence Crystal|KTKCG} used by 2.

item.name: Fainting Fumes
entries: When released, this poison fills a 10-foot radius around the source. You can accurately throw a vial of it (shattering on impact) at a point up to 30 feet away, or release it by other means. A creature subjected to this poison must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC equal to the crafter's Poison DC. On failure, the target becomes {@condition poisoned} for 1 hour. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the creature is also {@condition unconscious} while {@condition poisoned} in this way. The creature wakes up if it takes damage or if another creature takes an action to shake it awake.

item.name: Figurine of Wondrous Power, Onyx Panther
entries: A figurine of wondrous power is a statuette of a beast small enough to fit in a pocket. If you use an action to speak the command word and throw the figurine to a point on the ground within 60 feet of you, the figurine becomes a living creature. If the space where the creature would appear is occupied by other creatures or objects, or if there isn't enough space for the creature, the figurine doesn't become a creature.
The creature is friendly to you and your companions. It understands your languages and obeys your spoken commands. If you issue no commands, the creature defends itself but takes no other actions.

The creature exists for a duration specific to each figurine. At the end of the duration, the creature reverts to its figurine form. It reverts to a figurine early if it drops to 0 hit points or if you use an action to speak the command word again while touching it. When the creature becomes a figurine again, its property can't be used again until a certain amount of time has passed, as specified in the figurine's description.
{@creature panther||Onyx Panther}.
This statuette of a panther can become a {@creature panther} for up to 8 hours. Once it has been used, it can't be used again until 2 days have passed.

item.name: Fire
entries: An chaotic flowing rune with no straight lines. It pulses with a flickering orange energy.

entries.name: Passive Effect
entries: When marked on armor or an item, an attuned wearer gains resistance to fire damage. When marked on a weapon, an attuned wielder deals deals {@damage 1d4} additional fire damage on hit with that weapon.

entries.name: Active Effect
entries: While attuned to an item with this rune, you can use that item to cast {@spell burning hands} (2nd level) as a bonus action without expending a spell slot. This uses the crafter's Rune DC (set at the time of carving the rune). Once a rune's power is used, the rune's active can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Flame Breathing Jerky
entries: A tough jerky with exotic flavoring. Very spicy, uncomfortably so. After a creature consumes this snack as an action, they gain the following benefits for the next 10 minutes:

items: You can't be put to sleep by magical means.
You have disadvantage on Wisdom checks.
You have disadvantage on Constitution saving throws to maintain {@condition concentration} on a spell.

You can use a bonus action to exhale fire at a target within 10 feet of you. The target must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 2d6} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

entries: You can eat a number of pieces of this jerky equal to your Constitution modifier per day.

item.name: Flametongue Oil
entries: As an action, you can coat a weapon in this oil and ignite it. For 1 minute, the ignited weapon burns, dealing an extra {@damage 2d6} fire to attacks made with it, and providing bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet.

item.name: Flickering Ruby
entries: This ruby flickers like a torch, giving off 5 feet a bright light and an additional 5 feet of dim light when not socketed. When socketed into a weapon, as an action you can cause the weapon to burst into flames, dealing an extra {@damage 1d4} fire damage for 1 minute. Once used in this way it can't be used again until dawn. When socketed into a ring or necklace, a creature wearing that piece of jewelry can use their action to cast the {@spell produce flame} cantrip.

item.name: Focusing Crystal
item.reqAttune: by a psionic character with one or more psi points
entries: While holding this crystal, you can use it to focus your mind, more perfectly opening your psionic senses. You can use this spell to cast {@spell clairvoyance} without expending psi points. Once while the effect is active, you can use a Psionic ability (power, spell or talent) that doesn't deal damage on a creature within range of the sensor as if it was in range and sight of you. You can't use this property again until you finish a long rest.

At the start of your turn, you can focus this crystal (as if {@condition concentration|PHB|concentrating} on a spell) and reduce your speed to 0. When you do so, until the end of your turn the range of all psionic abilities with a range other than touch are doubled.

item.name: Folding Cart
entries: This object appears as a wooden box that measures 12 inches long, 6 inches wide, and 6 inches deep. It weighs 4 pounds and floats. It can be opened to store items inside. This item also has command words, each requiring you to use an action to speak it.
One command word causes the box to unfold into a cart 10 feet long, 4 feet wide, and 2 feet deep. The cart can hold up to four Medium creatures comfortably.

The third command word causes the folding cart to fold back into a box, provided that no creatures are aboard. Any objects in the cart that can't fit inside the box remain outside the box as it folds. Any objects in the cart that can fit inside the box do so.

item.name: Frost
entries: An angular geometric rune that softly pulses with a faint white light.

entries.name: Passive Effect
entries: When marked on armor or an item, an attuned wearer gains resistance to cold damage. When marked on a weapon, an attuned wielder deals deals {@damage 1d4} additional cold damage on hit with that weapon.

entries.name: Active Effect
entries: While attuned to an item with this rune, you can grant yourself 10 temporary hit points as a bonus action, lasting for 1 hour. If a creature hits you with a melee attack while you have these hit points, the creature takes 5 cold damage. Once a rune's power is used, the rune's active can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Frost Oil
entries: As an action, you can coat a weapon in this oil, causing it freeze over, covered in icy crystals. For 1 minute, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 1d6} cold damage on hit.

item.name: Galvanic Spine
entries: A segmented metallic whip that crackles with lightning. You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic whip, and it deals an extra {@damage 1d4} lightning damage on hit.

This whip is highly articulated and can move with surgical precision, allowing it to serve as an extended reach for certain tasks. As an action, you can attempt to {@action grapple} a creature, entangling with the whip. When you do so, you can make a Dexterity ({@skill Athletics}) check to initiate and maintain the grapple (instead of Strength). A creature that starts its turn while {@condition grappled} with this whip takes {@damage 1d4} lightning damage.

Additionally, you can pick up objects weighing 10 pounds or less within 10 feet, pulling them toward you, or interact with objects within 10 feet. You can use as a set of {@item thieves' tools|PHB} +1 when interacting with objects within 10 feet.

item.name: Gargoyle's Heart
entries: A gem like heart that forms inside gargoyles that have been animated for a certain number of years.

When you add this to a potion, any creature that consumes the potion develops are tough rock-like skin. Their AC can't be less than 16, regardless of what kind of armor they are wearing, and they become immune to critical strikes. These effects fade when the effects of the potion fade, or last 1 hour if the potion would otherwise not have duration.

item.name: Glittering Garnet
entries: This blood red gem glitters like blood in the dark. When socket into a melee weapon, any time a creature deals more than 10 slashing or piecing damage to a target with blood, the wielder regains 1 hit point. When socketed into a ring or necklace, the wearer regains an additional hit point when they spend a Hit Die.

item.name: Goodberry Dispenser
entries: This wand has 10 charges. While holding it as an an action you can tap the tip to your palm and expend 1 of its charges to create a single berry as if from the {@spell goodberry} spell in your hand.

The wand regains {@dice 1d10} expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the wand's last charge, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, the wand explodes, producing a splattering burst of sticky and sour juice.

item.name: Gravity
entries: An rune formed of detailed concentric circles that faintly glimmers with soft purple glow.

entries.name: Passive Effect
entries: When marked on armor or an item, or a weapon, an attuned wielder takes no falling damage.

entries.name: Active Effect
entries: While attuned to an item with this rune, you can use that item to cast {@spell levitate} as a bonus action without expending a spell slot. This uses the creator's Rune DC (set at the time of carving the rune). Once a rune's power is used, the rune's active can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Grenade Casing
entries: A simple construction of a two chambered projectile (typically made of glass). When you add an {@item Alchemical Fire|KTKCG} and an Explosive to its separate compartments, it becomes an incredibly dangerous device. As an action, a character can light this bomb and throw it at a point up to 60 feet away. Creatures within the range of the explosive used must make a Dexterity saving throw against the DC of the explosive used, or take damage equal to the explosion + {@damage 1d4} piercing damage + {@damage 1d4} fire damage.

item.name: Grievous Injury Poison
entries: Applied to a melee weapon or up to 5 pieces of ammunition.

A creature subjected to this poison must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC equal to the crafter's Poison DC, taking {@damage 6d6} poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful save.
Once applied, the poison retains potency for 1 minute before drying, and wears off of a weapon after that weapon has delivered the effect 5 times.

item.name: Hearty Meat Feast
entries: Up to 5 creatures can consume this feast within an hour of it being prepared. After consuming this hearty meal, you become satiated for the next 24 hours. Consuming the essence of a properly prepared creature of great power confers some of its power to you while satiated by the feast.

You can add +2 to ability checks and saving throws of the prepared creatures highest stat (if multiple stats are tied, the cook chooses which when preparing the meal). Alternatively, the cook can bring forth exotic properties of the creature, conferring one trait of the cooked animal to those that consume it as per the following table (this replaces the benefit to ability checks and saves):

entries.caption: Meat Feast Boons
rows: Hold Breath, Keen Senses, Pounce, Stone Camouflage

entries: The details from the creature boon can be found on the creature stat block. The cook must be aware of the creature's property to make the meal imbue that property, and the GM may adjust the property in cases where it would not work for players or be too powerful as written. At the GM's discretion, any ability can be added to this list.

item.name: Helm of Heroes
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to AC if you're wearing no armor while wearing this helmet. You can still use a {@item shield|PHB} and gain this benefit. In addition, while wearing no armor, the helm becomes suffused with glory and glimmers for 1 minute whenever you roll a 20 on an attack roll. While the helm is glimmering in this way, you gain temporary hit points at the start of each of your turns equal to half your level, and friendly creatures within 10 feet of you can't be {@condition frightened}.
Item and art by {@link Griffon's Saddlebag|https://www.thegriffonssaddlebag.com/}

item.name: Hero's Sheath
entries: An ornate sheath built for a {@item longsword|PHB}, this sheath infuses a blade stored within with divine power. When you draw a weapon stored in this sheath, the first attack you make with it after drawing it forth has a range of 30/60 (using the weapons normal attack modifier), and deals radiant damage instead of slashing damage.

If you expend a spell slot to empower this special attack using your {@classFeature Divine Smite|Paladin|PHB|2} feature, the blade emits a holy blast that deals damage equal to the {@classFeature Divine Smite|Paladin|PHB|2} targeting all creatures within 15 feet. The range of the cone increases by 15 feet for each level of spell slot expended on the {@classFeature Divine Smite|Paladin|PHB|2}. The target of the attack takes the {@classFeature Divine Smite|Paladin|PHB|2} damage as normal if the attack hits, while all other creatures in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw with a DC of 16. On failure, they take radiant damage equal to the damage dice of the {@classFeature Divine Smite|Paladin|PHB|2} damage (this is not doubled if the attack is a critical hit), or half as much damage on a successful saving throw.

A {@item longsword|PHB} that is sheathed in this sheath for at least 24 hours is infused with divine power. Its damage die is increased by one step (from a {@dice d8} to a {@dice d10}, and its versatile damage from a {@dice d10} to a {@dice d12}) and it counts as magical for the purposes of overcoming resistance to damage. This bonus lasts until another weapon is sheathed in this sheath.

item.name: Heroes' Feast
entries: A magnificent spread of food. Cooking this has the effect of casting the spell {@spell heroes' feast}, except it's made of real food and not poofed into existence by strange magics.

item.name: Holy Symbol of the Arcane
entries: This is a special {@item holy symbol|PHB} often belonging to the order of a god dedicated to knowledge or magic, imbued with special power by the god or their agents with the ability to confer arcane magic to a disciple.

When an attuned user is preparing spells for the day, they can prepare spells from the wizard spell list in addition to the cleric spell list, but any spell prepared in this way is prepared at one level higher than it normally would be. For example, if they were to use this holy symbol to prepare the {@spell fireball} spell from the wizard list, it would be prepared as if were normally a 4th-level spell (not gaining benefits from being up casted as a 4th-level spell).
An attuned cleric can have a number of spells prepared this way equal to their Wisdom modifier.

item.name: Hulking Bracers
entries: While wearing these {@item bracers|KTKCG}, as an action you can gain the Enlarge effect from the {@spell enlarge/reduce} spell without requiring a spell slot or {@condition concentration}. The effect lasts until deactivated as a bonus action. You can remain enlarged for up to 1 hour per day, all at once or in several shorter uses. If you run out of time while enlarged, you shrink to your normal size. The {@item bracers|KTKCG} regain their 1 hour of usage at dawn each day.

item.name: Imprint Crystal
entries: While attuned, you gain one {@filter Psionic Talent|optionalfeatures|feature type=PsiT} from the {@class Psion|ktp}{@sup K} class. It can't be one with any prerequisites.

item.name: Iron Rations
entries: Iron rations refers to field rations involving dried and perserved food. A basic food ration that will keep you from starving for a day after consuming them. Common side effects include a craving for real food after prolonged exposure.

item.name: Javelin of the Harpy Eagle
entries: This barbed javelin embeds itself into creatures and hinders their movement. A creature hit by this javelin has its speed reduced by 10 feet until the javelin is removed. While you are within 120 feet of the javelin and you can see it, you can use a bonus action to speak its command word, causing the javelin to viciously remove itself from the target and fly back to your open hand or to an unoccupied space at your feet. You can choose to remove the javelin as a part of the attack while wielding it in melee. Alternatively, any creature can remove the javelin with an action. When the javelin is removed, the barbs deal an extra {@damage 1d6} piercing damage to the creature.
{@note Item and art by {@link Dungeon Strugglers|https://www.artstation.com/dungeon_strugglers}}

item.name: Knockout Poison
entries: Applied to a melee weapon or up to 5 pieces of ammunition. A creature subjected to this poison must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC equal to the crafter's Poison DC.

On failure, the target becomes {@condition poisoned} for 1 hour. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the creature is also {@condition unconscious} while {@condition poisoned} in this way. The creature wakes up if it takes damage or if another creature takes an action to shake it awake.
Once applied, the poison retains potency for 1 minute before drying, and wears off of a weapon after that weapon has delivered the effect 5 times.

item.name: Lantern Shield
entries: This bizarre {@item leather buckler|KTKCG|buckler} has a lantern, a gauntlet, defensive spikes, and a {@item shortsword|PHB} built into it. You must wear the gauntlet in order to wield it, and it only grants a +1 bonus to AC. The {@item bullseye lantern|PHB} concealed within the shield casts bright light in a 60-foot cone and dim light for an additional 60 feet. Once lit, it burns for 6 hours on a {@item oil (flask)|PHB|flask (1 pint) of oil}. The aperture that sheds light through the shield can be opened or closed with a bonus action while wearing the gauntlet, instantly igniting or extinguishing the lantern.

While the lantern is covered and you are attacked in darkness by a creature within 60 feet of you that is also in darkness, you can reveal the light (no action required) to momentarily {@condition blinded|PHB|blind} the attacker, imposing disadvantage on the attack. A creature can't be {@condition blinded} in this way again for 24 hours.
If a creature within 5 feet of you misses you with a melee attack, you can use your reaction to deal {@damage 1d4} piercing damage to the attacker with the shield's defensive spikes.

Additionally, the shield has a {@item shortsword|PHB} built into it that can be wielded while wearing the gauntlet. You can deploy or retract it with a bonus action. You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls with this {@item shortsword|PHB} and you are proficient with this weapon if you are proficient with shields. Attacks with this weapon are made with disadvantage if you are holding a weapon without the light property, or an object longer than 1 foot or heavier than 5 pounds in your gauntlet hand.
{@note Item and art by {@link Dungeon Strugglers|https://www.artstation.com/dungeon_strugglers}}

item.name: Legendary Feast
entries: Up to 5 creatures can consume this feast within an hour of it being prepared. After consuming this hearty meal, you become satiated for the next 24 hours. You gain the benefits for a {@item common feast|KTKCG}, but can gain additional benefits by trading in Hit Dice that would be gained as part of your next long rest after consuming this meal. These Hit Dice are consumed after calculating how many you would have after the rest (including the benefits of the feast), but you can trade Hit Dice in this way you would normally lose if you have more than your maximum Hit Dice.
You can trade Hit Dice in this way up to a number equal to your proficiency bonus. The benefits scale based on the rarity on the feast.

entries.name: Legendary Benefits
items: Roll a {@dice d12} per Hit Die traded and gain temporary hit points equal to the value rolled.
Trade three Hit Dice for an additional spell slot of 4th level.
Gain a point that can be expended like Inspiration by trading 2 Hit Dice per point.

entries: Any benefit from a feast fades after 24 hours.

item.name: Legendary Meat Feast
entries: Up to 5 creatures can consume this feast within an hour of it being prepared. After consuming this hearty meal, you become satiated for the next 24 hours. Consuming the essence of a properly prepared creature of great power confers some of its power to you while satiated by the feast.

You can add +4 to ability checks and saving throws of the prepared creatures highest stat (if multiple stats are tied, the cook chooses which when preparing the meal). Alternatively, the cook can bring forth exotic properties of the creature, conferring one trait of the cooked animal to those that consume it as per the following table (this replaces the benefit to ability checks and saves):

The details from the creature boon can be found on the creature stat block. The cook must be aware of the creature's property to make the meal imbue that property, and the GM may adjust the property in cases where it would not work for players or be too powerful as written. At the GM's discretion, any ability can be added to this list.

item.name: Lesser Wand of 1st-Level Spell
entries: This wand has 3 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast the spell infused in it it. For 1 charge, you cast the base version of the spell. You can increase the spell slot level by one for each additional charge you expend (if applicable for the spell). The DC of the spell is crafter's Wand DC.
The wand doesn't regain charges naturally, but can be recharged (see recharge rules for Lesser Wands).

item.name: Lesser Wand of 2nd-Level Spell
entries: This wand has 3 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast the spell infused in it it. For 1 charge, you cast the base version of the spell. You can increase the spell slot level by one for each additional charge you expend (if applicable for the spell). The DC of the spell is crafter's Wand DC.
The wand doesn't regain charges naturally, but can be recharged (see recharge rules for Lesser Wands).

item.name: Lesser Wand of 3rd-Level Spell
entries: This wand has 3 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast the spell infused in it it. For 1 charge, you cast the base version of the spell. You can increase the spell slot level by one for each additional charge you expend (if applicable for the spell). The DC of the spell is crafter's Wand DC.
The wand doesn't regain charges naturally, but can be recharged (see recharge rules for Lesser Wands).
Lesser wands that cast 3rd-level spells or higher require attunement to use.

item.name: Lesser Wand of 4th-Level Spell

You can increase the spell slot level by one for each additional charge you expend (if applicable for the spell). The DC of the spell is crafter's Wand DC.
The wand doesn't regain charges naturally, but can be recharged (see recharge rules for Lesser Wands).

You can increase the spell slot level by one for each additional charge you expend (if applicable for the spell). The DC of the spell is crafter's Wand DC.
The wand doesn't regain charges naturally, but can be recharged (see recharge rules for Lesser Wands).
Lesser wands that cast 3rd-level spells or higher require attunement to use.

You can increase the spell slot level by one for each additional charge you expend (if applicable for the spell). The DC of the spell is crafter's Wand DC.
The wand doesn't regain charges naturally, but can be recharged (see recharge rules for Lesser Wands).
Lesser wands that cast 3rd-level spells or higher require attunement to use.

You can increase the spell slot level by one for each additional charge you expend (if applicable for the spell). The DC of the spell is crafter's Wand DC.
The wand doesn't regain charges naturally, but can be recharged (see recharge rules for Lesser Wands).
Lesser wands that cast 3rd-level spells or higher require attunement to use.

entries: This wand has 3 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast the spell infused in it it. For 1 charge, you cast the base version of the spell. You can increase the spell slot level by one for each additional charge you expend (if applicable for the spell). The DC of the spell is crafter's Wand DC.
The wand doesn't regain charges naturally, but can be recharged (see recharge rules for Lesser Wands).
Lesser wands that cast 3rd-level spells or higher require attunement to use.

item.name: Lesser Wand of 9th-Level Spell
entries: This wand has 3 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast the spell infused in it it. For 1 charge, you cast the base version of the spell. You can increase the spell slot level by one for each additional charge you expend (if applicable for the spell). The DC of the spell is crafter's Wand DC.
The wand doesn't regain charges naturally, but can be recharged (see recharge rules for Lesser Wands).
Lesser wands that cast 3rd-level spells or higher require attunement to use.

item.name: Lesser Wand of Cantrip
entries: This wand has 3 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast the spell infused in it it. For 1 charge, you cast the base version of the spell. You can increase the spell slot level by one for each additional charge you expend (if applicable for the spell). The DC of the spell is crafter's Wand DC.
The wand doesn't regain charges naturally, but can be recharged (see recharge rules for Lesser Wands).

item.name: Light
entries: A simple circular rune the shines a constant white light. A creature that touches an item bearing this rune can cast the {@spell light} spell targeting that item.

item.name: Lightning
entries: A jagged rune that flashes and crackles with blue light.

entries.name: Passive Effect
entries: When marked on armor or an item, the wearer's speed is increased by 10 feet. When marked on a weapon, an attuned wielder deals an extra {@damage 1d4} lightning damage on hit with that weapon.

entries.name: Active Effect
entries: While attuned to an item with this rune, you can use that item to cast {@spell crackle|KibblesTasty:cc}{@sup K} as a bonus action without expending a spell slot. This uses the crafter's Rune {@action Attack} Modifier and Rune DC (set at the time of carving the rune). Once a rune's power is used, the rune's active can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Liquid Lightning
entries: {@note Content licensed or commissioned from {@link Dungeon Strugglers|https://www.artstation.com/dungeon_strugglers}.}

Drinking this potion allows you to zip around for 1 minute as pure electricity. As a bonus action on each of your turns before the effect ends, you can transform into a bolt of lightning and instantly travel in a straight line to an unoccupied space you can see within 30 feet. This movement doesn't provoke {@action opportunity attack|PHB|opportunity attacks} and you are immune to lightning damage while in this form.

You can pass through small holes, narrow openings, and even mere cracks, as well as through conductive materials such as metal. Each creature in your travel path must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, or take {@damage 3d6} lightning damage. You immediately revert to your normal form upon reaching the destination. This potion's stormy liquid arcs with tiny bolts of lightning and it numbs the tongue when sipped.

item.name: Lost Era Emanator
entries: This ancient device is fueled by a mysterious power source. It hums to life and glows softly when held. The device's arcane design is nearly inscrutable and requires careful examination to decipher its function. In order to attune to the device, you must first succeed on a {@dc 16} {@skill Arcana} check, otherwise the attunement fails and you can't attempt it again for 24 hours.

The device has 12 charges. While holding it, you can use the attack action to emit a ray of concentrated heat from the device, expending 1 charge for each attack. The device functions as a ranged weapon with the ammunition and two-handed properties, a normal range of 60 feet, and a long range of 240 feet. While you are attuned to it, you can add your proficiency bonus to attack rolls with the device. Additionally, when you attack with the device, you can use your Intelligence modifier, instead of Dexterity, for the attack rolls. The device deals {@damage 3d8} fire damage (this damage doesn't benefit from ability score modifiers) to any target it hits.

As an action, you can expend 3 charges to fire a supercharged ray from the device. The ray is 90 feet long and 6 inches wide. Any creature within this area must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw and take {@damage 8d8} fire damage on a failure, or half damage on a success. This ray is able to penetrate through 1 inch of metal, 6 inches of stone, or 1 foot of wood, leaving a scorched hole 6 inches in diameter.

The device regains charges by storing arcane energy. Any creature can cast a spell of 1st through 6th level into the device by touching it as the spell is cast. The spell has no effect, other than to be stored in the device. If the device can't hold the spell, the spell is expended without effect. The device regains 1 charge for each level of spell slot used.
{@note Item and art by {@link Dungeon Strugglers|https://www.artstation.com/dungeon_strugglers}}

Orville examined the strange device that he had just unearthed. It gleamed and glinted in the torchlight, despite its apparent age, and the craftsmanship was like nothing he had ever seen. He traced his finger along the intricate grooves and amber-like appendages, daydreaming about the people who could have crafted such a curious contraption.

item.name: Lucky Material Pouch
entries: A small magical bag that always seems to have the material you need at the bottom of it. As an action, you can reach out and draw out any crafting material worth 1 gp or less. After each time you do so, roll a {@dice d4}. On a 1, the bag is empty and no more materials can be retrieved until the next dawn.

item.name: Magic Diamond
entries: This diamond gives off 5 feet of bright light and 5 feet of dim light when not socketed. When socketed into a weapon, the weapon becomes magical for the purposes of overcoming resistance.
